edu.vt.middleware.ldap
Class Authenticator

java.lang.Object
  edu.vt.middleware.ldap.AbstractLdap<AuthenticatorConfig>
      edu.vt.middleware.ldap.Authenticator
All Implemented Interfaces:
BaseLdap
public class Authenticator
extends AbstractLdap<AuthenticatorConfig>

Authenticator contains functions for authenticating a user against a LDAP.

Version:
$Revision: 466 $ $Date: 2009-08-20 14:05:31 -0400 (Thu, 20 Aug 2009) $

Middleware Services

getDn

public java.lang.String getDn(java.lang.String user)
                       throws javax.naming.NamingException
This will attempt to find the dn for the supplied user. AuthenticatorConfig.getUserField() is used to look up the dn. If more than one entry matches the search, the first result is used. If AuthenticatorConfig.setConstructDn(boolean) has been set to true, then the dn will be created by combining the userField and the base dn.

Parameters:
user - String to find dn for
Returns:
String - user's dn
Throws:
javax.naming.NamingException - if the LDAP search fails

authenticate

public boolean authenticate()
                     throws javax.naming.NamingException
This will authenticate credentials by binding to the LDAP using parameters given by AuthenticatorConfig.setUser(java.lang.String) and AuthenticatorConfig.setCredential(java.lang.Object). See authenticate(String, Object) If AuthenticatorConfig.setAuthorizationFilter(java.lang.String) has been called, then it will be used to authorize the user by performing an ldap compare. See authenticate(String, Object)

Returns:
boolean - whether the bind succeeded
Throws:
javax.naming.NamingException - if the authentication fails for any other reason than invalid credentials

authenticate

public boolean authenticate(java.lang.String user,
                            java.lang.Object credential)
                     throws javax.naming.NamingException
This will authenticate credentials by binding to the LDAP with the supplied user and credential. The user's DN will be looked up before performing the bind by searching on the user field, unless constructDn has been set. The user field default is set to 'uid', so to authenticate 'dfisher', uid must equal dfisher in the LDAP. If AuthenticatorConfig.setAuthorizationFilter(java.lang.String) has been called, then it will be used to authorize the user by performing an ldap compare. See authenticateAndAuthorize( String, Object, String, AuthenticationResultHandler...)

Parameters:
user - String username for bind
credential - Object credential for bind
Returns:
boolean - whether the bind succeeded
Throws:
javax.naming.NamingException - if the authentication fails for any other reason than invalid credentials

authenticate

public boolean authenticate(java.lang.String user,
                            java.lang.Object credential,
                            java.lang.String filter)
                     throws javax.naming.NamingException
This will authenticate credentials by binding to the LDAP with the supplied user and credential. The user's DN will be looked up before performing the bind by searching on the user field, unless constructDn has been set. The user field default is set to 'uid', so to authenticate 'dfisher', uid must equal dfisher in the LDAP. See authenticateAndAuthorize(String, Object, String, AuthenticationResultHandler...)

Parameters:
user - String username for bind
credential - Object credential for bind
filter - String to authorize user
Returns:
boolean - whether the bind succeeded
Throws:
javax.naming.NamingException - if the authentication fails for any other reason than invalid credentials

authenticate

public boolean authenticate(java.lang.String user,
                            java.lang.Object credential,
                            java.lang.String filter,
                            AuthenticationResultHandler... handler)
                     throws javax.naming.NamingException
This will authenticate credentials by binding to the LDAP with the supplied user and credential. The user's DN will be looked up before performing the bind by searching on the user field, unless constructDn has been set. The user field default is set to 'uid', so to authenticate 'dfisher', uid must equal dfisher in the LDAP. See authenticateAndAuthorize(String, Object, String, AuthenticationResultHandler...)

Parameters:
user - String username for bind
credential - Object credential for bind
filter - String to authorize user
handler - AuthenticationResultHandler[] to post process authentication results
Returns:
boolean - whether the bind succeeded
Throws:
javax.naming.NamingException - if the authentication fails for any other reason than invalid credentials

authenticate

public javax.naming.directory.Attributes authenticate(java.lang.String[] retAttrs)
                                               throws javax.naming.NamingException
This will authenticate credentials by binding to the LDAP using parameters given by AuthenticatorConfig.setUser(java.lang.String) and AuthenticatorConfig.setCredential(java.lang.Object). If AuthenticatorConfig.setAuthorizationFilter(java.lang.String) has been called, then it will be used to authorize the user by performing an ldap compare. See authenticate(String,Object,String[])

Parameters:
retAttrs - String[] attributes to return
Returns:
Attributes - of authenticated user
Throws:
javax.naming.NamingException - if any of the ldap operations fail

authenticate

public javax.naming.directory.Attributes authenticate(java.lang.String user,
                                                      java.lang.Object credential,
                                                      java.lang.String[] retAttrs)
                                               throws javax.naming.NamingException
This will authenticate credentials by binding to the LDAP with the supplied user and credential. The user's DN will be looked up before performing the bind by searching on the user field, unless constructDn has been set. The user field default is set to 'uid', so to authenticate 'dfisher', uid must equal dfisher in the LDAP. If AuthenticatorConfig.setAuthorizationFilter(java.lang.String) has been called, then it will be used to authorize the user by performing an ldap compare. See authenticate(String, Object, String, String[])

credential - Object credential for bind

authenticate

public javax.naming.directory.Attributes authenticate(java.lang.String user,
                                                      java.lang.Object credential,
                                                      java.lang.String filter,
                                                      java.lang.String[] retAttrs,
                                                      AuthenticationResultHandler... handler)
                                               throws javax.naming.NamingException
This will authenticate credentials by binding to the LDAP with the supplied user and credential. The user's DN will be looked up before performing the bind by searching on the user field, unless constructDn has been set. The user field default is set to 'uid', so to authenticate 'dfisher', uid must equal dfisher in the LDAP. See authenticateAndAuthorize(String, Object, String, boolean, String[], AuthenticationResultHandler...)

Parameters:
user - String username for bind
credential - Object credential for bind
filter - String to authorize user
retAttrs - String[] to return
handler - AuthenticationResultHandler[] to post process authentication results
Returns:
Attributes - of authenticated user
Throws:
javax.naming.NamingException - if any of the ldap operations fail

public boolean authenticateDn(java.lang.String dn,
                              java.lang.Object credential)
                       throws javax.naming.NamingException
This will authenticate credentials by binding to the LDAP with the supplied dn and credential. If AuthenticatorConfig.setAuthorizationFilter(java.lang.String) has been called, then it will be used to authorize the user by performing an ldap compare. See authenticateAndAuthorize(String, Object, String, AuthenticationResultHandler...)

Parameters:
dn - String dn for bind
credential - Object credential for bind
Returns:
boolean - whether the bind succeeded
Throws:
javax.naming.NamingException - if the authentication fails for any other reason than invalid credentials
